comment: If you're taking the online course, Google is your best friend for tests. All you need to do once a week is submit something into the discussions section and that's it. First to submit a discussion? Extra credit. Easy.

I took her online. Overall the class was confusing and I never was really sure what I was doing. Lots of reading for tests. 4 tests and 4 module responses over the whole semester. She's really caring and understood when I sprained my knee and missed a week of work. She's really nice and willing to work with you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Even though the class is online, the test questtions are difficult and tough to find in the book unless you have memorized the paintings.  Timed tests make it very hard.  I studeid my tail off and managed a C or B on every test, just barely pulling a B in the class.

You have to do tons of reading in the book and memorize specific facts.  Since the tests are timed you donot have time to look up everything in the book as you will run out of time.  Itsa hard class, trust me.

I took her for 3D and she was great! I mean, it would have been nice if she had a TA or something to help her out because a lot of us  would sit forever waiting for her to be done helping someone else. But she's extremely nice and laid back. The tests are take homeopen book but still really hard. I'd take her again though!

I toke her for 3D and she is awesome! Small tests & lil quizes. One of my favorite professors! She is kind and understanding. She gives great feedback and respects hard work. I actually kept my projects instead of throwing them in the trash after the class was over. She is easy to talk to. I can't wait to take her small metal class! Take her class!

Don't take her for your required art class! Her tests are surprisingly hard. Even though its internet based, the tests are definitely tricky and poorly worded. You also cannot see what questions you missed. Debra won't help you at all. You are on your own! You must participate in 5 modules and take 4 tests. I recommend you take someone more helpful

She by far the best teacher in the world! I messed up on the second test and she offered extra credit, which caused me to get an A in the class! I sincerely recommend her! I took her class as a minimester (August 2-8) and it was worth it.

This is not an easy A.  I studied hard for the 1st test and only made a low B.  THe online book is better for test taking.  She is very nice and helpful if you have any questions.  Test questions are picky, but an A is doable!

She's a very nice person & a fair professor. 3D Design can be hard for people not familiar w/ it, but if you put in the effort she sees that & will grade accordingly. When she has quizzes/tests she will use the book so you'll need that. (Mostly she just asks about definitions.) Overall I would recommend. You'd have to be trying to get a bad grade!
Lectures are very boring. Read the book and you will pass. All tests are straight out of the book. EASY A!

Nice professor, but the tests are very hard! I thought it would be an easy A, but she makes you work hard for it. Does not give a accurate study guide. Isn't clear when projects are due or how to complete them. VERY monotone during her lectures and makes it hard to stay awake. Also, super strict during tests. Very paranoid someone will cheat.

Easiest A ever. She gives many chances to earn extra cred. 1 paper, 1 museum visit, 3 tests, no final. Very lenient on deadlines. I think she'd rather be in  studio class haha, so she doesn't make art appreciation  harder than need be. Not an art snob, fun to talk to! Study pictures on study guide in book and do vocab, you'll be fine.
I really enjoyed Professor Hutchison's 3D Design class. She is very warm and encouraging. Tests and quizzes are easy (take-home, open book).

Very sweet lady, slightly scattered brained when discussing topics. DEFINITELY buy the book!! Tests are VERY hard and you must read all the chapters to even try to pass. However, she is very understanding and nice.

She asks questions throughout the lecture on what the impact of a work is, or what the artist meant on an element of a piece. What she fails to realize is that many students don't know, don't care, or they don't think there is any hidden meaning. If she gets frustrated enough, she has you write the answer to her question anyway

I don't know why previous comments have said that she is scattered and unorganized. Every time she enters class, she is organized and ready to present her lecture. You NEED the book to study for the tests. She does not take attendance, but it helps if you attend class. She offers a little extra credit which will help. Its pretty much an easy A.

She has been the best teacher I have had. She is different from other teachers, which makes her a great teacher. If you think outside the box and don't do things last minute, she'll like your work. Don't take her criticism harshly, it's for your own good in expanding your creativity. Don't be afraid to go out of your thinking zone! :)

She is one of the greatest teachers I have had. Prior to this class I had no interest in 3D stuff, now i love it, she has made it interesting and fun. If you go to class and really push yourself, you can create some great stuff! I highly recommend her!

She is very nice and relatively casual, but she is a little all over the place. I had her for metals and she did a lot of deadline extensions for my class and a lot of the final projects didn't get done in time, but she was very understanding. Written assignments were easy. She does know her stuff and is a good teacher.
Very nice lady but a bit scattered. Not completely clear on deadlines or assignments.

I took her for 3D design. She's a little all over the place. She would come in say some words and leave for like half the class while we were suppose to know what was going on. Her test and quizzes make NO SENSE whatsoever. She's so so so nice but a little hard to understand exactly what she wants out of art.

She is not real organized, but she is a genuinely nice lady who just wants you to reach deep-down inside to find inspiration for the artwork you will produce in her class. She will guide you, but you have to be responsible enough to check Vista regularly and know when due dates are. She is flexible & willing to help you every step of the the way.

An ok class. Dr. Hutchinson can be somewhat unclear and disorganized at times, but she is a nice person. A lot of the problems with the class are the university's fault, not hers. She usually puts lecture notes online, the tests are easy, and she is a lenient grader on subjective assignments.
I like her.  I know she can be a bit disorganized, but isn't that an artistic trait?  She listens to student comments about art and doesn't demean or ignore our attempts to critique.
find another professor for this class if possible.

Yes she is unorganized but she is a great teacher.  She did not make the power points or tests, the art department does so that is not her fault.  She does not look down on your ideas like some other art teachers do, & she is very encouraging.

No, she is not very well organized, but if YOU paid attention you would know what was going on. YOU are responsible for checking WebCT for new posts. Very lenient. She will work with you if you have a problem. Quizzes are done at home. The final exam is in class, open book. Only three projects in the semester.

Her tests are not worded the best way and her computer skills are lacking. She is nice, but pretty intimidating. She is very, very helpful with the projects. However, I feel like I did a lot of work in this class and I don't have much to show for it.

She isn't the best teacher I've had, but isnt the worst. She has a tendancy to be scatter brained and a bit unorganized, but is very nice. You'll do interesting and fun projects for 3d. Check vista nightly because she posts things late at night that are due the next day. She is relatively leniant with due dates,and will always help you if you ask.

Horrible class!! Extremely boring. Her attendence records were inaccurate (I went to every class but she said I miss 2?!?!)She was unclear on deadlines for test, papers, etc. They were ever changing. She would say one thing during lectures and then say something else. Got off subject. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!

She didn't know what she was talking about. She didn't really know what was on her powerpoints. she would not make the dates of tests, due dates for papers and projects clear. Then she would change the dates without warning.
